content.webTitle: Chelsea v Barcelona: the last four meetings

fields.headline: Chelsea v Barcelona: the last four meetings at Stamford Bridge
fields.bodyText: History is on Chelsea's side this evening, with the west London club having beaten Barcelona three times at Stamford Bridge in the last decade. The Spanish side have not kept a clean sheet in any of the four games. Chelsea 3-1 Barcelona Quarter-final first leg, 5 April 2000 Scorers: Zola 30, Flo 34, 38; Figo 64 Inspired by Gianfranco Zola's free-kick, Chelsea scored three times in eight minutes in the first half. However, Luís Figo pulled one back and Barcelona won the return leg 5-1 after extra-time to progress to the semi-finals. Chelsea 4-2 Barcelona Last 16 second leg, 8 March 2005 Scorers: Gudjohnsen 8, Lampard 17, Duff 19, Terry 76; Ronaldinho 27, 38 Trailing 2-1 from the first leg, Chelsea produced a stunning start to go 3-0 up in 20 minutes. Ronaldinho's brilliance gave the Spaniards the advantage but John Terry's late header sent Chelsea through. Chelsea 1-2 Barcelona Last 16 first leg, 22 February 2006 Scorers: Motta og 59; Terry og 71, Eto'o79 On a mudbath Chelsea had to play an hour with 10 men after Asier Del Horno was sent off for a foul on Lionel Messi. Barcelona recovered from Thiago Motta's own goal to take a lead to Camp Nou. Chelsea 1-0 Barcelona Group stage, 18 October 2006 Scorer: Drogba 4 Didier Drogba's strike was the difference the last time the two sides met at the Bridge. Seven of the side that managed to keep a clean sheet for Chelsea are expected to line up again tonight.
